page.title: 19POLICE VISIT TO CLERMISTON
page.content: One of the concerns the police have is to protect children. One day recently two policemen came to our school to remind us of the dangers of going with strangers. They first told us that there is no way to distinguish bad people from others; they are not all men; they do not all live alone and they do not all wear glasses. We were shown a film in which a girl was waiting outside a school for her mum. A man in a car drove up and offered her some sweets. He said he knew she wasn't supposed to talk to strangers, but that he wasn't a stranger. He offered her a lift and she accepted though she should have said no. The man took her to his own house and attacked her. Her parents were very worried, but she was lucky because someone heard her scream and she was discovered. {SAY NO TO STRANGERS.}
